subject: AW: [junit] Testing of  EJBs using Junit on weblogic server
msgSnippet: We just test the client-side, i.e. the methods of the remote interface. Thus you dont have to deploy anything differently. The only thing necessary with
messageBody:
We just test the client-side, i.e. the methods of the remote interface.
Thus you dont have to deploy anything differently.
The only thing necessary with weblogic is, one should use the
-noloading option when running tests.

junit.swingui.TestRunner.main(
new String[] { yourTest.class.getName(), "-noloading" } );

or use the textui.TestRunner


- Lucas
